May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.

BOARD OF VISITORS. THOMAS JEFFERSON. Rector. THOMAS JEFFERSON, JAMES MADISON, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOSEPH C. CABELL, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, JOHN H. COCKE, GEORGE LOYALL. Secretary of the Board, NICHOLAS P. TRIST.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, Chairman of the Faculty. GEORGE LONG, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. BLÆTTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. TH: HEWITT KEY, Professor of Mathematics. CHARLES BONNYCASTLE, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, Professor of An. and Medicine, JOHN TAYLOE LOMAX, Professor of Law. JOHN P. EMMET, Secretary of the Faculty. WILLIAM WERTENBAKER, Librarian. ARTHUR S. BROCKENBROUGH, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. SECOND SESSION.—FEB. 1ST, 1826. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L. — Ancient Languages. M. L. — Modern Languages. M. — Mathematics. N. P. — Natural Philosophy. C. — Chemistry. M. P. — Moral Philosophy. MED. — Medicine. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. Aikin, Richard Petersburg, Va. M L, 1 Allen, William E. Fredericksburg, Va. M L, M P, C, 2 Allmond, Henry Norfolk, Va.
